intro: Epistephium rhombilabium, commonly known as the diamond-lipped epistephium, is a rare and striking member of the Gesneriaceae family. It is native to the tropical rainforests of South America, particularly in regions of Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its vibrant, tubular flowers that range in color from deep red to orange, often with a distinctive diamond-shaped lip. Its leaves are typically ovate, with a glossy surface and a velvety texture. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is highly sought after by botanists and plant enthusiasts alike.
